intro: Pedicularis pushpangadanii, commonly known as the Pushpangadan's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred petals and often grows in moist, shaded environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pink or purple flowers. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
